title: Why Organic Milk Lasts Longer

items.name: Ultra-pasteurization process
items.details: Organic milk is heated to about 280F (138C) for 2-4 seconds, killing virtually all bacteria and significantly extending shelf life compared to regular pasteurization (161F for 15 seconds).

items.name: Distribution needs
items.details: Organic milk is often distributed nationwide, so ultra-pasteurization ensures it stays fresh during longer transportation and storage.

items.name: Packaging
items.details: Usually designed to be airtight and light-resistant, further preserving the milk.

items.name: Nutritional differences
items.details: Ultra-pasteurization can slightly reduce heat-sensitive vitamins (B12, folate), but losses are minimal. May cause a slightly 'cooked' flavor.

items.name: Why non-organic milk isn't ultra-pasteurized
items.details: Non-organic milk has shorter, more local distribution chains. Consumers prefer the fresher taste of regular pasteurization, and ultra-pasteurization equipment costs more.

notes: Both ultra-pasteurized and regularly pasteurized milk are safe and healthy. Choose ultra-pasteurized for longer shelf life and convenience, or regular pasteurized for fresher taste and minimal processing.
